title.value: Cortico-Cerebellar neurodynamics during social interaction in Autism Spectrum Disorders
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as provided in the header section.
title.quote: Cortico-Cerebellar neurodynamics during social interaction in Autism Spectrum Disorders

extractions.description: The paper investigates the electrophysiological activity of the cerebro-cerebellar network during real-time social interaction in individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD) focusing on theta oscillations, using the Human Dynamic Clamp paradigm with high-density electroencephalography (HD-EEG).

type.justification: The study involves empirical experiments using HD-EEG to collect and analyze data from participants with ASD and typical development.
type.quote: We combined the Human Dynamic Clamp, a paradigm for studying realistic social interactions using a virtual avatar, with high-density electroencephalography (HD-EEG).

name.justification: The research is focused on understanding the neurological dynamics and connectivity in individuals with ASD during social interactions, which is a topic within neuroscience.
name.quote: Exploring neural network dynamics during social interaction could help to identify biomarkers of Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD).

name.justification: The study uses electroencephalography (HD-EEG) to investigate neurological activity.
name.quote: We combined the Human Dynamic Clamp, a paradigm for studying realistic social interactions using a virtual avatar, with high-density electroencephalography (HD-EEG).

name.justification: The study specifically investigates autism spectrum disorders during real-time social interactions.
name.quote: Here, we investigated the electrophysiological activity of the cerebro-cerebellar network during real-time social interaction in ASD.

name.justification: The paper describes the Human Dynamic Clamp as a novel paradigm used to study real-time social interactions.
name.quote: We recently developed a novel paradigm, the Human Dynamic Clamp (HDC), for studying real-time social interactions based on interpersonal coordination between a human and a Virtual Partner (VP).

is_contributed.justification: The paper mentions the development of a novel paradigm, indicating a contribution to the field.
is_contributed.quote: We recently developed a novel paradigm, the Human Dynamic Clamp (HDC)...

is_executed.justification: The paradigm was actively used in the experiments conducted in the study.
is_executed.quote: We combined the Human Dynamic Clamp, a paradigm for studying realistic social interactions using a virtual avatar, with high-density electroencephalography (HD-EEG).

is_compared.justification: There is no mention of comparison to other models within the paper specifically related to the Human Dynamic Clamp.
is_compared.quote: The paper focuses on the execution of the Human Dynamic Clamp in the study rather than its comparison.

referenced_paper_title.value: The human dynamic clamp as a paradigm for social interaction
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper discusses the novel paradigm used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Dumas, G., de Guzman, G.C., Tognoli, E., Kelso, J.A.S., 2014a. The human dynamic clamp as a paradigm for social interaction.

name.justification: The paper uses MNE-Python for data preprocessing and analysis.
name.quote: HD-EEG data were preprocessed offline with the open-source software package MNE-Python.

referenced_paper_title.value: MEG and EEG data analysis with MNE-Python
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper referenced is about the MNE-Python library used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Gramfort A, Luessi M, Larson E, Engemann D, Strohmeier D, Brodbeck C, et al. MEG and EEG data analysis with MNE-Python.
